010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * Scalar version of the Perona-Malik filter, without gradient array.
019 * This code is based on the Anisotropic Diffusion filter proposed by Perona and Malik,
020 * as proposed in [1]. See Sec. 17.3.2 of [2] for additional details.
021 * The filter operates on all types of grayscale (scalar) and RGB color images.
022 * Consult the source code of the related ImageJ plugins for examples.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * [1] Pietro Perona and Jitendra Malik, "Scale-space and edge detection 
026 * using anisotropic diffusion", IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis 
027 * and Machine Intelligence, vol. 12, no. 4, pp. 629-639 (July 1990).
028 * <br>
029 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
030 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
031 * </p>
032 * 
033 * @author WB
034 * @version 2021/01/02
035 */
036public class PeronaMalikFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements PeronaMalikF {
037        
038        private final int iterations;           // number of iterations
039        private final float alpha;
040        private final ConductanceFunction g;
041        private final float[] A = new float[4];                 // tmp array for neighbor values
042        
043        // constructor - using default parameters
044        public PeronaMalikFilterScalar () {
045                this(new Parameters());
046        }
047        
048        // constructor - use this version to set all parameters
049        public PeronaMalikFilterScalar (Parameters params) {
050                this.iterations = params.iterations;
051                this.alpha = (float)params.alpha;
052                this.g = ConductanceFunction.get(params.conductanceFunType, (float)params.kappa);
053        }
054        
055        // ------------------------------------------------------
056        
057        @Override
058        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
059                /*   
060                 *  NH pixels:      directions:
061                 *      a1              1
062                 *   a2 ac a0        2  x  0
063                 *      a3              3
064                 */
065                
066                float ac = plane.getVal(u, v);
067                A[0] = plane.getVal(u + 1, v);
068                A[1] = plane.getVal(u, v - 1);
069                A[2] = plane.getVal(u - 1, v);
070                A[3] = plane.getVal(u, v + 1);
071                        
072                float delta = 0;
073                for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
074                        float d = A[i] - ac;
075                        delta = delta + (g.eval(Math.abs(d))) * d;
076                }
077                
078                return ac + alpha * delta;
079        }
080        
081//      @Override
082//      protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
083//              /*   
084//               *  NH pixels:      directions:
085//               *      p4              3
086//               *   p3 p0 p1        2  x  0
087//               *      p2              1
088//               */
089//              float[] p = new float[5];
090//              p[0] = plane.getVal(u, v);
091//              p[1] = plane.getVal(u + 1, v);
092//              p[2] = plane.getVal(u, v + 1);
093//              p[3] = plane.getVal(u - 1, v);
094//              p[4] = plane.getVal(u, v - 1);
095//                      
096//              float result = p[0];
097//              for (int i = 1; i <= 4; i++) {
098//                      float d = p[i] - p[0];
099//                      result = result + alpha * (g.eval(Math.abs(d))) * (d);
100//              }
101//              
102//              return result;
103//      }
104
105        @Override
106        protected final int passesRequired() {
107                return iterations;      // this filter needs T passes
108        }
109
110}
